intro: Gypsophila purpurea, commonly known as the baby's breath, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of Asia. It is characterized by its delicate, clustered inflorescences of small, white or pinkish flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm and thrives in full sun and well-drained soil. Its leaves are narrow and linear, often covered in fine hairs. Gypsophila purpurea is widely used in floral arrangements due to its fluffy appearance and long-lasting blooms.
